learning_objectives.description: Describe genetic modification as changing the genetic material of an organism by removing, changing or inserting individual genes
Understand that the gene that controls the production of human insulin has been inserted into bacterial DNA, for commercial production of insulin
Outline the use of genetic modification in crop plants by inserting genes: (a) to confer resistance to herbicides (b) to confer resistance to insect pests (c) to provide additional vitamins
Discuss potential advantages and risks of genetic modification, limited to modifying crop plants and bacteria
